criteria: Knowledge of Adequate Rest and Sleep
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of personal hygiene practices or their importance.
Shows limited understanding of basic personal hygiene practices; struggles to explain their significance.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of personal hygiene practices, such as hand washing and showering, but may not fully grasp their importance for overall health.
Demonstrates a clear understanding of essential personal hygiene practices and can explain their importance in preventing illness.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of various personal hygiene practices, including oral hygiene, and can explain their impact on overall health and well-being.
Demonstrates an exceptional understanding of personal hygiene practices and their profound impact on health; proactively seeks out additional information and applies it effectively.
Does not follow any plan for personal hygiene or sleep.
Attempts to create a personal hygiene plan, but it is incomplete or unrealistic.
Creates a basic plan for personal hygiene and sleep, but struggles with consistent implementation.
Implements a personal hygiene plan with reasonable consistency, showing effort to maintain good habits.
Consistently follows a well-structured personal hygiene plan and adjusts it as needed based on individual needs and circumstances.
Exemplifies consistent adherence to a comprehensive personal hygiene plan, proactively adapting it to optimize health and well-being; serves as a role model for others.
Demonstrates no understanding of the importance of rest and sleep for health.
Shows limited awareness of the role of sleep in maintaining health; struggles to identify factors affecting sleep quality.
Understands that sleep is important for health but lacks specific knowledge about sleep duration and sleep hygiene practices.
Demonstrates a good understanding of the recommended sleep duration and basic sleep hygiene practices for optimal health.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the factors influencing sleep quality and implements strategies to improve sleep hygiene.
Possesses an exceptional understanding of sleep science and its impact on overall well-being; consistently prioritizes sleep and educates others on its importance.
